oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Story of Prophet Abraham translated from a Persian text (possibly Muʻīn ad-Dīn Farāhi's "Maʻārij an-nubūwwah fī madārij al-futuwwah"), story of Prophet Zakariya from a text entitled Māālamil tanzīl (possibly Abū Muḥammad Ḥusain bin Masʻūd Baǵavī's "Maʻālim at-tanzīl") and two stories from the Sakhāvat nāma (possibly Sakhāvat nāma-i Ḥaẓrat ʻĀlī, the popular versified account of the miracles attributed to Ḥaẓrat ʻAlī).
Written in black ink, 14 lines per page.
Multiple sections, variation on cleat sewing through cuts in spine folds; covers missing. Edges of first five folios frayed.
MS Indic 2534. Houghton Library, Harvard University.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ismaili literature
Ismailites
Religious literature
Islamic sects
